com.lowagie.text
Class Paragraph

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection
      java.util.AbstractList
          java.util.ArrayList
              com.lowagie.text.Phrase
                  com.lowagie.text.Paragraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Collection, Element, List, MarkupAttributes, RandomAccess, Serializable, TextElementArray
Direct Known Subclasses:
ListItem
public class Paragraph
extends Phrase
implements TextElementArray, MarkupAttributes

A Paragraph is a series of Chunks and/or Phrases.

A Paragraph has the same qualities of a Phrase, but also some additional layout-parameters:

  • the indentation
  • the alignment of the text
Example: 
 Paragraph p = new Paragraph("This is a paragraph",
               FontFactory.getFont(FontFactory.HELVETICA, 18, Font.BOLDITALIC, new Color(0, 0, 255)));

See Also:
Element, Phrase, ListItem, Serialized Form
